net.cloud.client.tracking

Class StatTracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.client.tracking.StatTracker

  • public class StatTracker
extends java.lang.Object
    A class which can be updated with various game statistics to keep track of how the application is doing. There are effectively two modes of operation: Always on and temporarily on. Always on will track operation always when the client is running. Temporarily on will only keep track when the statistics overlay interface is open.
    Updates will periodically be written to a log file, via a scheduled task.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StatTracker

        private StatTracker()
        Default private constructor for singleton pattern

    • Method Detail

      • instance

        public static StatTracker instance()
        Obtain a StatTracker which can be informed of going-ons in the application
        Returns:
        The singleton instance of the StatTracker

      • overlayOpened

        public void overlayOpened()
        Inform the StatTracker that the statistics overlay has been opened and is now showing. If the mode is set to TEMP_ON, then this will start tracking.

      • overlayClosed

        public void overlayClosed()
        Inform the StatTracker that the statistics overlay has been closed is is no longer showing. If the mode is set to TEMP_ON, then this will stop tracking.

      • getStats

        public StatContainer getStats()
        Obtain the object holding information on the current system stats. This can then be cloned to create a StatContainer as a record of a specific moment.
        Returns:
        The current system statistics container

      • updateDrawStats

        public void updateDrawStats(int time)
        Update statistics and status information pertaining to drawing.
        Parameters:
        time - The amount of time the draw loop took in milliseconds

      • tracking

        private boolean tracking()
        Check to see if we are currently tracking statistics
        Returns:
        True if tracking should be done

      • createTrackingTask

        private CancellableVoidTask createTrackingTask()
        Create a Task which will write the current statistic information to the log file. This method is synchronized with the mode methods since a lot of its usage revolves around them. Just in case. Re-entrance woo!
        Returns:
        A Task to be scheduled at a fixed rate. It will write to the log file.
